./VulnDB/RDBO/AuthUser.pm

  • package VulnDB::RDBO::AuthUser
  • EOF
   1 package VulnDB::RDBO::AuthUser;
   2 
   3 use strict;
   4 
   5 use base qw(VulnDB::RDBO);
   6 
   7 __PACKAGE__->meta->setup(
   8     table   => 'auth_user',
   9 
  10     columns => [
  11         id           => { type => 'integer', not_null => 1 },
  12         username     => { type => 'varchar', default => '', length => 30, not_null => 1 },
  13         first_name   => { type => 'varchar', default => '', length => 30, not_null => 1 },
  14         last_name    => { type => 'varchar', default => '', length => 30, not_null => 1 },
  15         email        => { type => 'varchar', default => '', length => 75, not_null => 1 },
  16         password     => { type => 'varchar', default => '', length => 128, not_null => 1 },
  17         is_staff     => { type => 'integer', default => '', not_null => 1 },
  18         is_active    => { type => 'integer', default => '', not_null => 1 },
  19         is_superuser => { type => 'integer', default => '', not_null => 1 },
  20         last_login   => { type => 'datetime', default => '', not_null => 1 },
  21         date_joined  => { type => 'datetime', default => '', not_null => 1 },
  22     ],
  23 
  24     primary_key_columns => [ 'id' ],
  25 
  26     unique_key => [ 'username' ],
  27 
  28     relationships => [
  29         user_criteria => {
  30             class      => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserCriteria',
  31             column_map => { id => 'user_id' },
  32             type       => 'one to many',
  33         },
  34 
  35         user_profile => {
  36             class      => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserProfile',
  37             column_map => { id => 'user_id' },
  38             type       => 'one to one',
  39         },
  40     ],
  41 );
  42 
  43 1;
